articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Bangladeshi President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Bangladeshi President
 Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Friday sent a  message of greetings to Zillur Rahman, president of Bangladesh, on the 40th anniversary of its independence. 
					 Kim in the message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in various fields by joint efforts. 
					
					 The message wished him good health and happiness and success in his work for the country's prosperity.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Greets Bangladeshi PM
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Greets Bangladeshi PM
 Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- Choe Yong Rim, premier of the DPRK, on Friday sent a message of greetings to Sheikh Hasina, prime minister of Bangladesh, on the 40th anniversary of its independence.
					 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, the message wished her great success in her work for the country's stability and economic development. 
					
					 Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun, too, sent a similar message to his Bangladeshi counterpart Dipu Moni on the same day.

articles.title: Togolese Leaders on Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Togolese Leaders on Relations with DPRK 
 Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- Jong Hak Se, DPRK ambassador to Togo, paid a courtesy call on the general secretary of the People's Rally and Prime Minister Gilbert Fossoun Houngbo of Togo on March 17.
					 The general secretary said President Kim Il Sung made great contribution to the cause of socialism. He praised the President as a great man who performed undying feats in building the Korean party, state and army. 
					
					Expressing admiration at the Songun feats of General Secretary Kim Jong Il who bolstered the national power of the DPRK, he further said:
					
					 We wish Kim Jong Il great success in his work to lead the Korean people in their drive to glorify 2012 marking the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung as a year of shining victory to be specially recorded in the history of building a thriving nation. 
					
					 We are convinced that the relations between the Togolese People's Rally and the Workers' Party of Korea will further develop. 
					
					 Saying that Togo and the DPRK have long developed the friendly and cooperative relations, the prime minister expressed the belief that these relations would grow stronger.

articles.title: Mexican Party to Boost Relations with WPK
articles.content:
Mexican Party to Boost Relations with WPK
 Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Mexico (WPM) will as ever steadily develop the comradely relationship with the dignified Workers' Party of Korea.
					 Alberto Anaya Gutierrez, coordinator of the National Coordinating Committee of the WPM, said this on Mar. 16 when he met Kwon Sung Chol, DPRK ambassador to Cuba. Kwon participated in the 15th seminar of the world political parties on building a new society as a delegate of the WPK.
					
					 The members of the WPM are greatly inspired by the big achievements made by the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people in their efforts to build a thriving nation and reunify the country under the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The coordinator expressed conviction that President Kim Il Sung's behests would be implemented under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Number of Doctors Increases
articles.content:
Number of Doctors Increases 
 Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- Thousands of scientists and technicians have been honored with doctorate for their distinguished services over the last decade.
					 They have contributed to developing metal, machine-building, chemical and other economic sectors and updating production facilities to suit the IT age.
					
					 Much more than a hundred of them are men and women in their twenties and thirties. 
					
					 Women doctors total a hundred and several dozens.
					
					 The number of families having two or more doctors has also increased. 
					
					 Among the doctors are officials of party and administrative organs and workers.

articles.title: Scientific, Cultural Heritages Created by Koreans
articles.content:
Scientific, Cultural Heritages Created by Koreans
 Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- The Korean people have developed science and culture with their own creative ability from olden times.
					 The Chomsongdae Observatory in Kyongju, built in the period of the three kingdoms (Koguryo, Paekje and Silla), is one of the scientific achievements made by the Korean people in ancient times.
					
					 With the observatory, the Koreans observed eclipse of the sun and moon, astronomical phenomena like comet, planet, meteor and climatic change like drought and flood. 
					
					 Metal type was invented in the period of Koryo, the first of its kind in the world.
					
					 The country's invention was hundreds of years earlier than Netherlands, Germany and other countries.
					
					 Many books like "Kokumsangjongrye" were published with the metal type.
					
					 A typical invention in the period of the Ri Dynasty is rain gauge.
					
					 Korea was also the first in the world to introduce a scientific method of precipitation measurement.

articles.title: Yaoyinggou Meeting
articles.content:
Yaoyinggou Meeting
 Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- March 27 is the 76th anniversary of the Yaoyinggou meeting of military and political carders of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army (KPRA).
					 On this occasion, the Korean people are looking back upon great feats of President Kim Il Sung in leading the anti-Japanese revolution to victory under the banner of Juche, the banner of independence.
					
					 On March 27, Juche 24 (1935), the President convened the meeting in Yaoyinggou, Wangqing County of China and put forward a new strategic policy of relinquishing the guerrilla zones and launching out the KPRA units in wide areas.
					
					 At that time, the Japanese imperialists were encircling the guerrilla zones with huge troops for "punitive operations".
					
					 Nevertheless, the Left adventurists ignored the change in situation and indiscreetly persisted in defense of the guerrilla zones. Their position was as foolish as waiting for death.
					
					 The President made a clear-cut analysis of the situation at the meeting and set forth the afore-said policy to bridge over the severe crisis and bring about a fresh upsurge in the anti-Japanese revolution.
					
					 The justness of the policy was clearly proved through the ensuing development of the anti-Japanese national liberation struggle as a whole.
					
					 After the voluntary dissolution of the guerrilla zones, the KPRA started large-unit activities in south and north Manchuria and wide areas of Korea to overshadow the enemy's numerical and technical superiority.
					
					 During the activities, the KPRA grew larger and the advance of small units and political operatives into the homeland became frequent.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Building Scientific and Technological Power
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Building Scientific and Technological Power
 Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- Scientists and technicians of the DPRK produced Korean-style CNC-based machine tools with their own technology and wisdom, demonstrating once again before the world the mettle and practical ability of the Korean people who do not know impossibility, says Rodong Sinmun Friday in a bylined article. 
					 Noting that CNC in the DPRK means CNC for independence, self-reliance and justice, the article goes on: 
					
					 It is the attraction and advantages of the Korean-style CNC to make it possible to produce as many things as one wants according to computer programs. 
					
					 Under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il the DPRK broke through the latest science and technology of CNC, thus providing the people with the inexhaustible strength to bravely foil any moves of the imperialist powers, a powerful treasured sword for winning a victory in the drive to build a thriving socialist nation. 
					
					 The DPRK's seizure of supremacy of CNC technology amounts to a shining victory of the independent line of the Workers' Party of Korea and its idea of attaching importance to science and technology and a striking demonstration of the inexhaustible strength of Juche Korea. 
					
					 The successful development of CNC in the DPRK convinces the independent forces that the latest science and technology are not a monopoly of imperialism but they can occupy the above-said eminence when they strive to attain it with a will. 
					
					 The high-pitched drive for developing Juche-based CNC deals a heavy blow at the hegemonic policy of the imperialists, the outdated forces of history, whereas it powerfully encourages the progressives desirous of justice to accomplish the sacred cause of independence and self-reliance.

articles.title: Koreans to Remain True to Idea of "By Our Nation Itself" Called for
articles.content:
Koreans to Remain True to Idea of "By Our Nation Itself" Called for
 Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- The idea of "By our nation itself" is a signpost for victory as it makes it possible to advance the national reunification movement under the banner of independence, says Rodong Sinmun Friday in a bylined article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 To maintain the principle and standpoint of independence in settling the issue of national reunification is an essential requirement for winning a final victory in the cause of reunification as it is a crucial matter on which hinges the victory in the national reunification movement.
					
					 The idea of "By our nation itself," the keynote of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, reflects the Koreans' strong idea of self-determination to achieve national reunification by themselves.
					
					 The DPRK remains unchanged in its principled stand and will to warm the north-south relations and bring earlier the independent reunification by thoroughly applying the above-said idea.
					
					 This idea reflects the desire and wishes of the members of the Korean nation to achieve unity among themselves irrespective of ideology and system.
					
					 The Koreans who have lived as a homogenous nation throughout their long history can achieve solid unity if they rely on the national character and patriotism.
					
					 The north-south ties remain tense and acute and the war-like forces are getting more frantic than ever before in their moves to escalate confrontation and ignite a war in a bid to hold in check the advance of the June 15 era of reunification.
					
					 The Korean nation, however, can neither stop its advance nor make any detour in face of manifold ordeal and hardships. It can neither vacillate nor stop their struggle halfway in face of undisguised challenges and obstructions by the anti-reunification forces.
					
					 The national reunification movement is sure to triumph when the above-said idea is held fast to as a lifeline.

articles.title: S. Korea's Opening to Public Scope of Armed Forces in War Exercises Ridiculed
articles.content:
S. Korea's Opening to Public Scope of Armed Forces in War Exercises Ridiculed
 Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- In recent years the south Korean military has frequently opened to the public the scope of its armed forces participating in all kinds of war maneuvers.
					 Whenever the south Korean authorities opened to the media the U.S.-led joint military exercises in the past, they hesitated very much to mention the scope of their armed forces involved while opening to the public the scope of the U.S. forces participating in the exercises.
					
					 But as soon as the present chief executive of south Korea came to power, they began giving wide publicity to the scope of troops of the puppet army participating in all the war maneuvers targeted against the DPRK.
					
					 For instance, they reported only once or twice about the scope of the troops of the puppet army involved in the joint military exercises up to 2007 but opened to the public almost all the forces involved in every joint war maneuver from 2008.
					
					 This year, too, they opened to the media the fact that huge forces of the puppet army would participate in the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises.
					
					 The above-said farce is nothing but a sort of publicity campaign against someone. 
					
					 This only betrays their reckless and belligerent nature as it is no more than a folly of the confrontation maniacs to browbeat the DPRK.
					
					 Such poor and ridiculous farce would get them nowhere.

articles.title: US, S. Korea Stage DPRK-targeted War Maneuvers
articles.content:
US, S. Korea Stage DPRK-targeted War Maneuvers
 Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and south Korea are staging coastal war supply drill around Anmyon Island in the West Sea of Korea, according to the south Korean KBS on March 23. This is part of the Foal Eagle joint military exercises.
					 The warmongers set in motion huge armed forces, warships and nearly 100 trucks to stage a drill for transporting war supplies, fanning up a war fever.
					
					 The south Korean authorities also announced that they would stage large live-shell demonstration firepower training in Kyonggi Province on March 24.

articles.title: Questionnaires over Warship Sinking Case
articles.content:
Questionnaires over Warship Sinking Case
 Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- The Center for Peace and Disarmament of the Citizens' Solidarity for Democratic Society in south Korea on Tuesday sent questionnaires on the sinking incident of warship "Cheonan" to the U.S. and Swedish ambassadors to south Korea. 
					 The questionnaires asked if the U.S. jointly carried out the investigation into the incident with the joint investigation team of south Korea or if it just rendered aid or played a supporting role. 
					
					 The organization also demanded that the Swedish investigation team make public the parts of the investigation in which it had been fully involved, the results of the investigation, the team's contribution to the final report, accuracy of the investigation processes, etc.

articles.title: S. Korean Business Files Damages Suit against Authorities
articles.content:
S. Korean Business Files Damages Suit against Authorities
 Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- A south Korean business filed a damages suit against the puppet government, according to the south Korean MBC. The business suffered huge damage due to the collapse of the north-south relations.
					 In the plaint submitted to the Seoul Central District Court the business demanded damages from the "government", saying that it is on the verge of bankruptcy due to the "government's" unreasonable ban on the cooperation between the south and the north.

articles.title: Repression of Academic Activities Flailed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Repression of Academic Activities Flailed in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea denounced the Lee Myung Bak regime for suppressing even the academic activities of students.
					 In its statement on Mar. 21 the organization noted that the police authorities kicked up the frantic crackdown on members of the students' economically academic organization that day and walked away at least 50 students protesting against this repression. 
					
					 The crackdown is a shameless deed and a declaration of war that the authorities would suppress not only the elementary academic meeting but also various political activities of students by invoking the "National Security Law", it charged.
					
					 This is also a deceptive move to divert elsewhere the public opinion increasingly critical of the corruption and irregularities of the ruling quarters, it said.
					
					 The Youth Solidarity of south Korea, too, issued a statement on Mar. 22 demanding that the authorities set free immediately the students arrested on unwarranted charges.

articles.title: DPRK Anniversaries Marked
articles.content:
DPRK Anniversaries Marked
Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- The Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea issued its bulletin on Mar. 20 to celebrate the 18th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and the 79th birthday of the Korean People's Army.
					 The bulletin carried an article titled "Invincible KPA" with a photograph of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 It said that the KPA has won one victory after another in the acute standoff with the United States and its satellite forces, defending socialism and reliably guaranteeing the victory of building a thriving nation. 
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The source of the inexhaustible and powerful strength of the KPA lies in the outstanding guiding idea and tactics with which it is equipped. 
					
					 President Kim Il Sung advanced the Juche-based military idea centered on the man and the solider masses.  
					
					 Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il has successfully carried forward the President's cause, thoroughly arming the KPA with the Juche-based military idea and training all the servicepersons to be those strong in idea and faith. 
					
					 The invincible might of the KPA is based on its political and ideological might matchless with any other army in the world. 
					
					 The whole army is replete with the revolutionary solider spirit the core of which is the absolute confidence and loyalty to its supreme commander.
					
					 Another source of the invincible power of the KPA is the great army-people unity and the military technical might.

articles.title: Japanese Get More Uneasy about Nuclear Power Plants
articles.content:
Japanese Get More Uneasy about Nuclear Power Plants
 Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- Social unrest is mounting about nuclear power plants in Japan owing to the nuclear disaster caused by the crippling quake and the ensuing tsunami.
					 Tokyo Shimbun on Mar. 19 said that according to a poll conducted in Tokyo, 88.1 percent of the respondents voiced uneasiness about the nuclear power plants.

articles.title: China Works on Recovering from Earthquake Damage
articles.content:
China Works on Recovering from Earthquake Damage
 Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- The Chinese party and government are directing much effort to helping people of Yingjiang County, Yunnan Province recover from the damage caused by an earthquake which hit the area on March 10 and stabilize their life.
					 The Organizational Department of the C.C., the Communist Party allocated a million RMB.Y from the party membership fees and the Ministry of Finance 55 million RMB.Y for the rescue work. 
					
					 The Ministry of Civil Affairs sent 5,000 tents, 10,000 quilts and 10,000 overcoats to victims.  
					
					 Taking part in the rescue work are servicepersons, policemen, reserve militiamen and youth, with the help of the State Council's rescue team and Red Cross organizations.
					
					 Many people have been rescued from debris and more than 8,000 people evacuated from the area.
					
					 Such basic issues as food, drinking water, clothing, lodging, treatment and public order have been mainly solved in the afflicted area.
					
					 About 90 percent of primary schools were reopened as of March 14.

articles.title: British Papers Accuse Japan of Belated Quake Information
articles.content:
British Papers Accuse Japan of Belated Quake Information
 Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- British newspapers on March 16 carried articles condemning Japan for its belated provision of information about explosions at nuclear power plant.
					 Independent said that fear rises over the explosions at the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear plant. This is attributable to the Tokyo Electric Power Co. that has been accustomed to concealing facts, it added.
					
					 The company had so far been blamed for abnormal operations such as concealing accidents and rewriting the repair-and-check records, the paper said, charging that it does not have sound history in releasing facts. 
					
					 The Guardian reported that the company has been blamed for its belated and insufficient information.

articles.title: Russian PM Brands Military Operation against Libya as Invasion
articles.content:
Russian PM Brands Military Operation against Libya as Invasion
Moscow, March 23 (KCNA) -- Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin on Monday branded the military operation against Libya by the U.S. and other Western countries as invasion from outside.
					 The resolution of the UN Security Council on Libya which allows invasion of a sovereign state is a harmful one as it is not perfect, he said, adding that it reminds one of the call for crusade expedition in the Middle ages.
					
					 What is happening in Libya goes to prove that everything done by Russia to bolster the combat capability of the country is just, he stressed.

articles.title: Russia Assails Military Attack on Libya
articles.content:
Russia Assails Military Attack on Libya
 Moscow, March 23 (KCNA) -- Zabardin, chairman of the National Defence Committee of the State Duma of Russia, on Monday denounced the U.S. and West-led military attack on Libya. 
					 The military operation against Libya by multinational forces reminds one of NATO's military operation against Yugoslavia, he said, adding that the "humanitarian intervention" only strains the regional situation.

articles.title: Venezuelan President Censures West's Attack on Libya
articles.content:
Venezuelan President Censures West's Attack on Libya 
 Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- President of Venezuela Hugo Chavez Frias denounced the West's military attack on Libya when interviewed by a TV broadcasting service on Mar. 19. 
					 He accused Western countries of unreasonably interfering in the internal affairs of an independent state in violation of international law.
					
					 They are only keen to control oil in Libya while being utterly indifferent to the lives of peaceable inhabitants, he added.

articles.title: Ugandan President Blasts West for Double Standards
articles.content:
Ugandan President Blasts West for Double Standards 
 Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- Ugandan President Yoweri Museveni in a statement on Monday blasted the West for double standards over the conflict in Libya.
					 As regards the military attack on Libya by multinational forces led by the West, he said that while imposing a no-fly zone in a rival country like Libya, the West turns a blind eye to similar cases in pro-West countries.

articles.title: Iranian Foreign Ministry Assails West's Military Operation against Libya
articles.content:
Iranian Foreign Ministry Assails West's Military Operation against Libya
 Teheran, March 23 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Iranian Foreign Ministry on Sunday said that the Western countries which kicked off a military operation against the Libyan regime are trying to establish neo-colonialist rule over Libya.
					 He held that their armed forces are, in fact, trying to occupy Libya under the pretext of protecting Libyan people.
					
					 They often act under the unctuous name of "aiding" people but they only pursue their interests, still enforcing a new-type colonial policy, he added.

articles.title: India Regrets Air Strikes on Libya
articles.content:
India Regrets Air Strikes on Libya 
 New Delhi, March 23 (KCNA) -- The Indian External Affairs Ministry in a statement Sunday regretted the military air strikes on Libya conducted by the United States and other Western countries.
					 The Western nations should not do anything that aggravates the already worsening situation for the people of Libya, the statement said.

articles.title: AU Demands Stop to Attack on Libya
articles.content:
AU Demands Stop to Attack on Libya
 Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- The African Union clarified its stand opposing Western nations' recent armed intervention in Libya. 
					 The AU strongly demanded that the multinational forces led by the U.S. and other Western countries stop at once their attack on Libya.

articles.title: US Blockade against Cuba Blasted
articles.content:
US Blockade against Cuba Blasted
 Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- The United States is further tightening its blockade against Cuba. 
					 It froze the UN aid fund for preventing infectious diseases some days ago. 
					
					 On March 11, a vice-minister of Trade and Foreign Investment of Cuba strongly denounced this as an illegal action hampering the aid project of an international organization. 
					
					 Cooperation is now under way among countries and regions and between international organizations and countries in different fields in the international arena. 
					
					 This cooperation is becoming more brisk as regards the issues of combating infectious diseases and disasters that seriously threaten the right of the people to existence. 
					
					 Nevertheless, the U.S. committed above-said outrage, once gain disclosing its true colors as a criminal against humanity. 
					
					 This is obviously an inhuman behavior diametrically running counter to the spirit of the UN calling for respecting the right of the people to existence and part of its vicious moves to tighten economic sanctions and blockade against Cuba.
					
					 As already reported, the U.S. has systematically worked hard to isolate and stifle Cuba for years. It has run the whole gamut of machinations including appeasement, deception, military threat and blackmail in a bid to stifle Cuba advancing along the road of socialism since the victory of the revolution, considering it as a thorn in its flesh. 
					
					 As Cuba has kept to its chosen road, not yielding to the above-said moves, the U.S. has resorted to dastardly economic sanctions and blockade against it. They inflicted enormous economic losses upon Cuba, bringing sufferings to its many people. 
					
					 The present reality indicates that the U.S. economic sanctions and blockade against Cuba are a wanton infringement upon the sovereignty of Cuba and serious human rights abuses aimed to isolate and stifle it and bring down its government. 
					
					 Nothing can justify the U.S. blockage against Cuba.

articles.title: UN Chief Slams Israel's Military Attack
articles.content:
UN Chief Slams Israel's Military Attack
 Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- The UN secretary-general in a statement on Tuesday slammed Israel's military attack on Gaza.
					 The statement strongly condemned the killing of three Palestinian children and their uncle and the wounding of 13 other civilians by an Israeli tank shell in the Gaza Strip.
					
					 It called on Israel to respect its obligations under international humanitarian law and human rights law.

articles.title: Russia Plans Modernization of Armed Forces
articles.content:
Russia Plans Modernization of Armed Forces 
 Moscow, March 23 (KCNA) -- Anatoly Serzhukov, Russian minister of Defense, talked about the country's plan to modernize the armed forces at a meeting on March 18.
					 It is a main task of the army units to improve the combat capability from a strategic perspective at present, he said, clarifying a plan to raise the modernization level of the military technical equipment of the federal armed forces up to 30 percent in the five years ahead.
					
					 The aerospace defense force will be organized in 2011, he added.

articles.title: Russian Plane Flies Close to Territorial Air of Japan
articles.content:
Russian Plane Flies Close to Territorial Air of Japan
 Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- Electric intelligence gathering plane Il-20 of the Russian air force flew close to the territorial air of Japan on Mar. 17, the Japanese Sankei Shimbun reported.
					 It said that the plane tried to reconnoiter the joint action of Japan and the U.S. over the recovery from the earthquake disaster.

articles.title: Russian Lawmaker Refers to Issue of Creation of Space Defense Force
articles.content:
Russian Lawmaker Refers to Issue of Creation of Space Defense Force
 Moscow, March 23 (KCNA) -- The chairman of the defense and security committee of the Russian Federal Assembly referred to the issue of creating a space defense force on March 18.
					 Pointing out that it is one of the priority tasks before the armed forces of the Russian Federation to create a space defense force, he made it clear that Russia would set up a command of the space defense force on the basis of the space group and air-defense means in all services and arms of the armed forces by 2016.

articles.title: Air Bases of Ground Force Established in Russia
articles.content:
Air Bases of Ground Force Established in Russia
 Moscow, March 23 (KCNA) -- Anatoly Serzhukov, minister of Defense of Russia, said at a meeting on Mar. 18 that eight air bases of the ground force have been established.
					 Their purpose is to boost the mobility and firing power of the ground force as the army units' deployment in strategic areas has been put on a precision basis, he added.

articles.title: Chinese Vice-Premier on Scientific and Technical Innovations
articles.content:
Chinese Vice-Premier on Scientific and Technical Innovations
 Beijing, March 23 (KCNA) -- Zhang Dejiang, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China and vice-premier of the State Council, while conducting a survey and study at the Space Science and Technology Group Corporation of China, underscored the need to push ahead with scientific and technical innovations at the national enterprises.
					 He called on the national enterprises to establish and round off the scientific and technical innovation system, break through key technologies as early as possible and train innovative scientific and technical talents.
					
					 He also stressed the need to make a great contribution to bringing adjustment to the economic growth mode and building an innovative country.

articles.title: China Promulgates Regulations on Press Management
articles.content:
China Promulgates Regulations on Press Management
						
Beijing, March 23 (KCNA) -- The State Council of China recently promulgated revised regulations on press management.
					Their purpose is to strengthen the press management and speed up the building of socialist spiritual and material civilization.
					
					The regulations underscore the need to widely disseminate science and technology and cultural knowledge helpful to economic development and social progress through press activities to enrich the people's mental life.

articles.title: Progress in Railway Construction in China
articles.content:
Progress in Railway Construction in China
 Beijing, March 23 (KCNA) -- China has made progress in the railway construction.
					 Its people rebuilt railways which were destroyed in the 1950s and the 1960s and stepped up the project of laying new railway sections. This provided a basic foundation for its economic development 
					
					 In the 1970s and the 1980s they built Chengdu-Kunming railways and several other sections, markedly improving the traffic conditions in the border districts and the inland areas. 
					
					 Since the 1990s the country pushed forward the projects of connecting railways across the country and converting them into electric tractions.  It also directed much effort to building railways in the western areas from 2000 to 2009.
					
					 By 2006 the railway networks made their appearance in almost all areas including those of minority peoples.
					
					 In recent five years 16,000 km-long railways have been built in the country. 
					
					 In particular, rapid transit railways have been constructed one after another. 
					
					 The construction of new railways promotes China's rapid economic growth, giving the country facelifts.

articles.title: Pakistani President Condemns Quran Burning by US National
articles.content:
Pakistani President Condemns Quran Burning by US National
 Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- Pakistani President Asif Ali Zardari Tuesday strongly condemned the burning of the Holy Quran by an American under the supervision of the infamous Terry Jones in Florida.
					 He, addressing a parliament, termed the burning a deliberate desecration of the Holy Quran. 
					
					 The minister of State for Foreign Affairs said that this reprehensible act is evidently designed to provoke dissent and discord among communities and people across the world.
					
					 "There could be no justification for such acts. This has deeply hurt the feelings of the people of Pakistan and Muslims all over the world," she said.

articles.title: Belarus to Stand Firm against US and West Sanctions
articles.content:
Belarus to Stand Firm against US and West Sanctions
Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- The director of the Information Department of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Belarus Tuesday clarified the government's stand against the U.S. and West sanctions.
					He said that the government worked out a list of Americans and Westerners whose entry into Belarus would be banned in return for the U.S. and the West which took measures to restrict visa for Belorussians and apply economic sanctions against Belarus.
					
					This step was taken because they committed acts against Belarus and deterred the international efforts for cooperation with it, he said.
					
					He stressed that the government would tighten control over foreign socio-political organizations and their representatives illegally funding some political forces in Belarus.

articles.title: Developing Countries' Efforts to Develop Education
articles.content:
Developing Countries' Efforts to Develop Education
 Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- Developing countries are paying great attention to education.
					 Hugo Chavez Frias, president of Venezuela, said that the government established a new education system to provide more people with opportunities to learn. He clarified his stand to increase the state concern for education in the future.
					
					 Yoweri Kaguta Museveni, Ugandan president, said that the government would enforce the free education system for higher school students from this year. 
					
					 Goodluck Ebele Jonathan, Nigerian president, declared that the government would channel huge funds into building a schoolhouse, a dormitory and a library of the university now under way in Bayelsa State.
					
					 Leonel Antonio Fernandez Reyna, president of Dominica, called upon the regional countries to pay bigger attention to education. 
					
					 The Bolivian government adopted a new education law on Dec. 20 last year.
					
					Ecuador built ten schools for the past four years, trained at least 20,000 teachers and supplied school things and uniforms to about one million students of higher educational institutions.
					
					 In Cuba the number of university graduates reached a total of one million by July last year after the victory of the revolution. 
					
					 India officially put into force the law on compulsory education from April 1 last year. Under this law all the children of school age up to 14 receive free education regardless of social status and sex. 
					
					 Zambia worked out a new curriculum for children to teach them how to speak and write in national language and actively introduced it to the field of primary education.

articles.title: Australia to Lose 45 Species in 20 Years
articles.content:
Australia to Lose 45 Species in 20 Years
 Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- The extinction of animals is getting serious in Australia owing to global warming.
					 Up to 45 native species in Western Australia's Kimberley region will die out within 20 years if no action is taken, the Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organization of Australia said on Wednesday.

articles.title: Emitido interrogatorio sobre caso del Cheonan en Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Emitido interrogatorio sobre caso del Cheonan en Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 25 de marzo (ATCC) -- El Centro de Desarme por la Paz de la Participacion Solidaria de Ciudadanos por la Sociedad Democratica del Sur de Corea emitio el dia 22 a los embajadores de Estados Unidos y Suecia acreditados en Sur de Corea sendos interrogatorios sobre el caso del hundimiento de la corbeta "Cheonan".
					El documento pregunta a EE.UU. si habia realizado una investigacion conjunta con el grupo surcoreano de pesquisa o cumplido solo el papel auxiliar. 
					
					Ademas, demando a Suecia dar a conocer el contenido y resultado de su investigacion, su papel en la elaboracion del informe final, la exactitud del curso de investigacion, etc.

articles.title: Personalidades politicas de Togo se refieren a relaciones con Corea
articles.content:
Personalidades politicas de Togo se refieren a relaciones con Corea
						
Pyongyang, 25 de marzo (ATCC) -- El embajador coreano, Jong Hak Se, hizo el dia 17 una visita de cortesia al secretario general de la Reunion del Pueblo Togoles y al premier de la Republica Togolesa, Gilbert Fossoun Houngbo.
					En la audiencia el secretario general dijo que el Presidente Kim Il Sung hizo gran aporte a la realizacion de la causa socialista y acumulo imborrables hazanas en la construccion del partido, el Estado y el ejercito de Corea.
					
					Manifesto homenaje a las proezas de la guia del Songun de Su Excelencia Kim Jong Il, quien fortalece la fuerza nacional de Corea.
					
					Deseo que el Dirigente logre grandes exitos en su labor para dirigir al pueblo coreano que lucha por hacer de 2012, centenario de natalicio del Presidente, el ano de relevantes victorias que se registrara especialmente en la historia de construccion de la gran potencia prospera.
					
					Expreso conviccion de que las relaciones entre la Reunion del Pueblo Togoles y el Partido del Trabajo de Corea se consolidaran y se desarrollaran mas.
					
					El premier togoles dijo a su vez que Togo y Corea han venido desarrollando las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion durante largo tiempo y manifesto la conviccion de que estas relaciones se fortaleceran tambien en el futuro.

articles.title: Coordinador del PTM aboga por el desarrollo de relaciones con el PTC
articles.content:
Coordinador del PTM aboga por el desarrollo de relaciones con el PTC
						
Pyongyang, 25 de marzo (ATCC) -- Alberto Anaya Gutierrez, coordinador del Comite de Coordinacion Nacional del Partido del Trabajo de Mexico, se reunio el dia 16 con Kwon Sung Chol, embajador coreano acreditado en Cuba, que participo en el XV seminario de los partidos politicos del mundo sobre la construccion de nueva sociedad en calidad de delegado del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					  En la ocasion Alberto dijo que estimulan mucho a los militantes de su partido los grandes exitos que alcanzan el PTC y el pueblo coreano en la lucha por construir una gran potencia prospera y lograr la reunificacion de la patria bajo la guia del Dirigente Kim Jong Il sobre la revolucion mediante el Songun.
					
					  Expreso su conviccion de que se materializaran sin falta los legados del Presidente Kim Il Sung bajo la guia del Dirigente.
					
					  Subrayo que el PTM seguira consolidando en el futuro tambien las relaciones camaraderiles con el prestigioso PTC.

articles.title: Crece en Corea el numero de doctores
articles.content:
Crece en Corea el numero de doctores
Pyongyang, 25 de marzo (ATCC) -- Durante mas de 10 anos ultimos, miles de cientificos y tecnicos coreanos recibieron el grado de doctor por sus meritos excepcionales.
					Ellos desarrollaron las ciencias basicas, exploraron los planos sofisticados para activar varios sectores de economia nacional como metalurgia, maquinaria, quimica, etc. y modernizaron las bases de produccion a la altura de la era IT.
					
					Entre ellos figuran ciento y decenas de jovenes veintenarios y treintanarios e igual numero de mujeres.
					
					En particular, aparecieron muchas familias en que recibieron el doctorado los matrimonios, padres e hijos o hermanos.
					
					En los periodos tan dificiles conocidos aqui como la marcha penosa, la forzada, ellos ayudaron mutuamente en la investigacion cientifica y la educacion de generaciones venideras anteponiendo la prosperidad de la patria a la felicidad familiar.
					
					Por otra parte, se hicieron doctores decenas de funcionarios administrativos y del partido y obreros.

articles.title: ATCC rechaza el bloqueo anticubano de EE.UU.
articles.content:
ATCC rechaza el bloqueo anticubano de EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 25 de marzo (ATCC) -- Hace poco, como parte de las medidas para recrudecer el bloqueo anticubano, Estados Unidos congelo los fondos de la ONU asignados a Cuba para combatir el SIDA, tuberculosis y malaria.
					El 11 de marzo, el viceministro cubano del Comercio Exterior e Inversion Extranjera denuncio que esa accion ilegal obstruye seriamente la cooperacion de esa organizacion multinacional.
					
					Hoy dia, en la palestra internacional, se dinamizan en varios sectores la cooperacion interestatal e interregional y la entre las organizaciones internacionales y los paises.
					
					En particular, ellas se tornan mas intensas cuando se tratan del combate contra epidemias y desastres naturales que amenazan gravemente la existencia de la humanidad.
					
					Sin embargo, EE.UU. volvio a demostrar su fechada de criminal de lesa humanidad congelando los referidos fondos de cooperacion de la ONU para Cuba.
					
					Tal gesto inhumanitario viola flagrantemente el espiritu de la ONU de respetar el derecho a la vida del hombre, siendo una practica de la brutal sancion economica y bloqueo.
					Estas medidas anticubanas se tomaron cuando resultaron fracasados los sistematicos intentos del imperio de atropellar y acorralar a la Cuba socialista, nacida a raiz del triunfo de la Revolucion Cubana, usando todos los recursos como seduccion, engano, amenaza y chantaje militares.
					
					Debido a esa sucia guerra economica contra Cuba, esta isla linda de las Antillas sufrio astronomicas perdidas economicas, lo cual afecto seriamente las condiciones de vida de su poblacion.
					
					La realidad demuestra que la sancion economica y el bloqueo contra Cuba constituyen un brutal atentado contra la soberania orientado a derrocar el gobierno cubano y una violacion flagrante de DDHH.
					
					EE.UU. debe levantar ahora mismo su injustificable bloqueo nticubano.
